Authors: Meiryani, Siagian P., Puspokusumo R.A.A.W., Lusianah
Title: Decision making and management information systems
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Siagian, P., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Puspokusumo, R.A.A.W., Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lusianah, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Management Information System is needed by public and private organizations. Management Information System is a system of support in making decisions taken by managers in overcoming problems that are happening in an organization both public and private organizations. Through MIS managers can make decisions wisely in the sense of being able to overcome the problems that are happening and the decision will not create greater problems that can disrupt the survival of an organization. the presence of computer technology has made a very positive contribution to the management information system and MIS is also very much needed by leaders in an organization or company for responsible decision making. © 2019 by Advance Scientific Research. This is an open-access article under the CC BY license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)
Author Keywords: Accounting; Decision Making; Information Systems; Management Information Systems

Title: Earnings quality determinants of lq 45 index listed companies in indonesia [Determinantes de calidad de ganancias del índice lq 45 empresas listadas en indonesia]
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ghaizani, D.N., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Siagian, P., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to analyze the effect of Investment Opportunity Set, Good Corporate Governance, and Firm Size on Earnings Quality of LQ45 Index listed on Indonesia Stock Exchange in 2013-2017 years. The purposive sampling method is using to determine all data needed which obtained from 22 companies as research sample. Those data was analyzed by multiple linear regression include descriptive analysis, classic assumption and hypothesis test. The results revealed are two independent variables such as Investment Opportunity Sets and Firm Size have significant effect on Earnings Quality. While Independent Commissioner and Managerial Ownership as Good Corporate Governance have no effect on Earnings Quality. This finding can enable policymakers to develop future policies that focus on earnings quality. This study also contributes to the literature by including observations from Indonesia. © 2018, Universidad del Zulia. All rights reserved.

Title: Orientalism in updike's terrorist [Orientalismo en el terrorista de updike]
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ghaizani, D.N., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Siagian, P., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Orientalism is considered as a mode of study of Eastern or Oriental dogmas, religion, culture and societies. It reflects how the Westerners view the Easterners. The title of the study aims to explore the concept of Orientalism from a selected western novel by Updike entitled Terrorist. The novel portrays the image of a Muslim-Arab character; Ahmad who is the protagonist of the novel Terrorist. The paper also shows how Muslim-Arabs are drawn to terrorism not because of their nature which are prone to terrorist acts but are due to the misinterpretation of the Holy Quran. The paper consists of three sections: the first section is an introduction about Updike's Terrorist The second section tackles the different viewpoints pertaining to the concept of Orientalism. Section three analyses Updike's novel as an Orientalist novel. Finally, the conclusion and recommendation for further studies are forwarded. © 2018, Universidad del Zulia. All rights reserved.

Authors: Meiryani M., Siagian P., Yadiati W., Warganegara D.L.
Title: The effect of risk management on the quality of accounting information systems: Integration, adaptability and ease of use dimensions [El efecto de la gestión de riesgos en la calidad de los sistemas de información contable: Integración, adaptabilidad y facilidad de uso de las dimensiones]
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics and Business, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; Accounting and Finance Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, M., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Siagian, P., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yadiati, W., Faculty of Economics and Business, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; Warganegara, D.L., Accounting and Finance Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Risk management is a concept that is often used as well as complex which is identified as a factor that can succeed or fail to achieve a quality accounting information system. The phenomenon that occurs shows that risk management has not shown optimal conditions. The purpose of this study is to find the truth through testing (confirmation) of the influence of risk management on the quality of the accounting information system. The data used was obtained through a survey by distributing questionnaires to 105 state-owned enterprises in Indonesia, processed statistically using PLS SEM. The research method uses explanatory research method, to get a fundamental answer to the cause and effect by analyzing the causes of problems in the quality of the accounting information system. The results of the study show that the accounting information system has not been qualified because risk management has not optimally anticipated the risks in using accounting information systems. © 2018, Universidad del Zulia. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Accounting information systems; Adaptability; Ease of use; Integration; Quality; Risk management

Title: Financial inclusion in Indonesia and its challenges
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Science and Humanities
Affiliations: Accounting and Finance Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sun, Y., Accounting and Finance Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Siagian, P., Accounting and Finance Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to observe the implementation of financial inclusion in Indonesia. Using Micro Enterprises (MEs) in traditional markets around Jakarta - Indonesia as the object of the research, approximately 20% MEs were found to have no banking facilities. Furthermore, instead of using credit facility, around 78% MEs still utilise their own capital to facilitate their businesses. The paper also examines the personal characteristics that can explain financial inclusion. Results revealed that only gender and education could explain financial inclusion. Morever, the findings also revealed that MEs generally demand for banking facility. Nevertheless, there are several barriers that hamper them from financially included. In particular, Self Exclusion and Marketing Exclusion are the most barriers that MEs face in accessing financial services.
Author Keywords: Financial Exclusion; Financial Inclusion; Micro Enterprises
References: Amaeshi, K.M., (2006) Financial Exclusion, Financial Institutions and Corporate Social Responsibility: A Developing Country Perspective, , Working Paper, Social Science Research Network (SSRN), Rochester, NY; Cnaan, R.A., Moodithaya, M.S., Handy, F., Financial inclusion: Lessons from rural south India (2012) Journal Social Policy, 41 (1), pp. 183-205; Fuller, D., Mellor, M., Banking for the poor: Addressing the needs of financially excluded Communities in Newcastle Upon Tyne (2008) Urban Studies, 45, pp. 1505-1524; Hannig, A., Jansen, S., Financial inclusion and financial stability: Current policy issues (2011) ADBI Working Paper Series, (259); Khaki, A.R., Sangmi, M.D., Financial inclusion in Jammu &kashmir: A study on bankers Initiatives (2012) Journal of Arts, Science &commerce, III, 4 (2), pp. 115-123; Leyshon, A., Signoretta, P., French, S., (2006) The Changing Geography of British Bank and Building Society Branch Networks 1995-2003, , http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/geography/general/news-events/; Mitton, L., (2008) Financial Inclusion in the UK: Review of Policy and Practice, , Bristol: Joseph Rowntree Foundation; (2009) Financial Inclusion: An Overview, , NABARD.
